cyclone.name: MINDY
cyclone.current_location: about 90 miles WSW of Apalachicola, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: racing northeast across the Florida Panhandle tonight, then moving off the southeast U.S. coast into the western Atlantic on Thursday

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical-storm warnings limited to Mexico Beach FL to Steinhatchee River FL (well east of Mississippi coast)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Same as watch area – Mexico Beach to Steinhatchee River, FL
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Primary impact zone is the eastern Florida Panhandle and immediate Big Bend coast; secondary impacts extend across southern GA/SC
weather_observation.wind: Occasional gusts below tropical-storm force possible, but sustained gale-force winds are unlikely at Pascagoula.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected along the Mississippi coast given the storm’s track well east of the area.
weather_observation.rainfall: Light outer-band showers possible; heavy rain focus remains over the Florida Panhandle and southeast Georgia.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Marginal risk of isolated brief tornadoes passes east of the port; no significant hazards anticipated for port operations.
